content:
Day 1:

Start with a traditional Spanish breakfast at Cafe de Oriente
Visit La Sagrada Familia, Antoni Gaudi's famous cathedral
Take a walking tour of Gothic Quarter, including its cathedral and Plaça Sant Jaume
Enjoy a delicious seafood lunch at La Barca del Salamanca
Explore Park Guell, another famous Gaudi landmark
Day 2:

Start the day with pastries and coffee at Forn Baluard
Visit the Picasso Museum to see works by the famous Spanish artist
Stop for lunch at Cal Pep, a popular tapas bar
Walk along La Rambla, a famous street known for its street performers and shopping
End the day with dinner at Casa Mono, a Catalan restaurant
Day 3:

Begin with a breakfast of churros and hot chocolate at Churrería La Estrella
Visit La Boqueria, a bustling food market
Stop by the Palau de la Música Catalana to admire its unique architecture
Enjoy a traditional paella lunch at Can Majó
Visit Casa Batlló, another iconic Gaudi building
Day 4:

Start the day with a coffee and croissant at Granja Viader
Visit the Joan Miro Foundation to see works by the Surrealist artist
Have lunch at El Quim de la Boqueria, a popular spot for seafood
Explore the Barcelona Cathedral, also known as the Cathedral of the Holy Cross and Saint Eulalia
End your trip with dinner at El Celler de Can Roca, a Michelin-starred restaurant.
Note: The activities and timings listed above are just suggestions, feel free to modify the itinerary to fit your interests and schedule.
